sections.content:
🌀 **Flipping Your Way Outta Brokieville** **- Chapter 1** 🌀

> This course is designed to give you the MINDSET and a SKILL you can use to make your first money without a job.
> 
> It's what I did to make money without a job back in my brokie days. Once you get this moving, we will take you to the next level.
> 
> Until then, click continue and begin your first training module.
> 
> EXTREMELY IMPORTANT NOTE: NEVER MEET A CUSTOMER AT NIGHT. ONLY MEET IN PUBLIC PLACES.

•




"The Importance of Your First Dollar"

Making your first dollar is the main focus of what you will be learning within these modules. Because once you make even your first $1 outside of a job, you begin a new path. The reality is, if you can make $1, you can make as much as you need to replace your 9-5 and give yourself the life you want.

But there is no magic in this. It comes down to you following what we will be talking about and taking action.

So let's dive in...

**Summary:**
- Working a 9-5 doesn’t give you the freedom to do what you want when you want
- Flipping will give you a skill you can use to make money on your own time
- If you can make 1 dollar you can make $10, $100, $1000 etc.

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

How should you feel after you make your first dollar?

a Ecstatic! This is the first time you made money on your own!
b Eh, it's only a dollar.

•




"Broke vs. Poor"

**Being broke and poor are 2 different things.**

**Summary:**
- Poor = don’t have the opportunities to get rich
- Broke = have the opportunities but haven’t made money yet
- You have control over being broke by developing a valuable skill

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

Are you Broke or Poor?

a Broke-
b Poor

•




"Why Most NEVER Make it Outta Brokieville"

**Summary:**
- Most people don’t believe it’s possible
- The content and community in Millionaire Access show you that it’s real
- They get stuck, without a valuable skillset

**Action steps:**
- Believe that you can escape Brokieville

Why is it important to make your first dollar?

a Because now I can buy cool things to impress others!
b More money is always good
c The reason it is important is now I know if I can make $1, I can make whatever I need if I put in the effort

•


💲 **Chapter 2 - Make Your First $100** 💲 

"What is Flipping?"

**Summary:**
- Flipping is the simple skill of finding items for free or cheap and then selling them for a profit. 
- The reason I like this skill so much for brokies (I used to be one) is that you don't need much if any money to get started. 
- All you really need is a phone or computer. From there you can start making money and grow.

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

Are you implementing the knoledge inside these videos?
a yes
b no

•




"What Types of Items Will I Sell?"

Your flipping business revolves around the items that you sell. YOU make money when you sell items for a profit.

So let's get into the types of items you can sell to make money.

**Summary:**
- Furniture, clothing, appliances
- Don’t limit yourself to one type of item
- Find items that are selling well, then sell more of them

**Action steps:**
- Identify items in your area that are selling well

What items should you sell?

a Anything as long as you get it for free
b Anything that you know sells well

•




"Why Do People Buy Items You Flip?"

**Summary:**
- Understand the mindset of people that are on flipping websites
- Learn to leverage unfair advantages

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

What makes you rich?

A Unfair Advantages
B Shitcoins

•




"What Are The Hot Items?"

**Summary:**
- If you don’t have specific selling platforms in your country, just search for alternatives in your country
- “What is the item I can most easily get for free or cheap?”
- Wood furniture, leather furniture, garden furniture, ornaments, electronic garden tools, power tools, household appliances, sports equipment, vintage sportswear, designer clothes & shoes, bikes, electronics

**Action steps:**
- Identify hot items that you can source easily for free or cheap

What do you do if you don't have craigslist in your country?
a Give up
b Search for alternatives

•




"What If I Don’t Have A Car?"

Not having a car isn't bad. You can ask your family, friends, rent one, or even just UBER to where you need.

Remember -> there is ALWAYS a solution to anything you face. For any excuse your brain or the world gives you, you can always find a way.

**Summary:**
- Use your parents’ car
- Use your friend’s car
- Rent a vehicle or U-Haul truck

**Action steps:**
- Source a vehicle for transporting your items

"What do I do If I Don’t Have A Car?"
a Give up.
b Go to the Millionaire Access general chat and complain this doesn't work.
c Use your parent's,friend's,rent or UBER. There is always a way.

•




"What If I Don’t Have A Bank Account?"

**Summary:**
- If you’re under 18, your parents can sign to give their permission for you to get a bank account
- Just use cash

**Action steps:**
- Open a bank account

•




"What If You Don’t Have Craigslist?"

Google is your best friend. For some of you, you won't have access to Craigslist or Facebook Marketplace. However, there is always an alternative.

**Example:**

Google - Craigslist alternative and you will get...

Gumtree - UK 
eBay - US
Facebook Marketplace - US & many other countries 
Poshmark
Quikr and OLX - India 

**Summary:**
Search “Craigslist alternatives in {your country}” on Google

**Action steps:**
Find selling platforms in your country

What is flipping?

a just a way to make money.
b Taking a free item or item you get for less and selling for profit.
c Clocking in for a paycheck.

•


🏘️ **Chapter 3 - Escaping Brokieville** 🏘️  

"Trash to Cash"

**Summary:**
- Aim to sell 5+ items per week quickly
- All you need is a phone and maybe a vehicle if you’re flipping larger items
- Use online selling platforms to list your items and have your items on as many platforms as you can
- You can rent U-Haul trucks to collect and store items if you grab a bunch of items at once
- If you have the means, get a storage unit in an easily accessible location

**Action steps:**
- Download selling platform apps to your phone
- Get it, list it, profit

•




"Listing Your First Item to Profit From"

**Summary:**
- Catchy headline - stand out
- Good photos - come from the perspective of your customer, they want to imagine the item
- Clear & concise description - brief description, accepted payment methods, contact info
- Proper pricing - never accept checks from strangers - use cash, Venmo or stripe
- Meet in a public place or preferably your storage unit
- Add $15-$45 for delivery to make sure they’re genuine

**Action steps:**
- List your first item following the guidelines

•




"Testing the Market When Flipping"

**Summary:**
- When you start flipping, you won’t know what items sell for profit
- In order to find out what sells, you need to test different items

**Action steps:**
- Ask in the VIP chat for items that people are selling
- Test different items and double down on the ones that make a good profit

•




"Finding Items to Profit From"

**Summary:**
- Best items to sell: furniture, appliances, electronics
- Adapt your items to your local area
Sell fewer items and make more money
- Use the free section on Craigslist - act fast and pay attention to the quality
- Evicted Tenant Goldmine - print business cards, tell apartment complexes to contact you when they evict someone
- Buying items - Goodwill/Habitat for Humanity, Thrift Stores, Garage Sales
Combine all these methods for maximum profits

**Action steps:**
- Test what items sell well in your area
- Create a spreadsheet of customers

•




"4 AI Tools For Flipping"

**Summary:**
- Copy.ai for product descriptions
- Let's Enhance for improving image quality
- Canva for removing backgrounds and editing product images
- Adobe Express for removing backgrounds and editing product images

**Action Steps:**
- Utilize AI in your flipping business
- Test what items sell well in your area
- Create a spreadsheet of customers

•




"Smaller Items Work"

**Summary:**
- Small items work but larger items can sell fewer for more money
- It can be easier to sell smaller items because you don’t need to worry about transport or storage

**Action steps:**
- Test flipping smaller items

•




"See What Items are Selling on Craigslist"

**Summary:**
- Market research - see what people are selling and notice patterns of items that are selling
- Go to in-person stores and garage sales and negotiate with them for items in high-income areas
- Save the information of everyone you sell to and upsell them other items you have (use a discount)
- Train someone to go out and get items for you, you take pictures, list them and make the sale

**Action steps:**
- Research the prices of items in your area
- Go out and negotiate to acquire an item

•




"How to Create Your First Craigslist Ad"

**Summary:**
- Keep re-posting your ad until the item sells
- Be honest with your descriptions
- Only give the details they actually need in the description

**Action steps:**
- Create your first ad

•




"Advanced Craigslist Tactics"

**Summary:**
- Find someone who has a truck, train them on what to buy and give them a debit card to buy stuff
- Find Facebook groups for buy/sell, add them to a Google doc
- Copy/paste your ads into these groups

**Action steps:**
- Join a local Facebook group for buy/sell

•




"How Flipping Teaches You Freelancing"

**Action steps:**
- Implement what you learned in the course

Why is it important to have good pictures/titles for your products?

a To make it look fancy.
b To make your products more attractive for your potential buyers.

•


👣 **Chapter 4 - Flipping Simple Steps** 👣

**"Make Your First $100 Course"**

The "Make Your First $100 Course" is your direct path from no money to your first $100 flipping.

You can repeat as much as you want.

Step 1) **Complete the Flipping Course**

> The first is for you to complete the course .
> 
> Pay attention to each video and take notes.
> 
> Anytime you have a question you ask it, with the "Ask the Professor" button or in "VIP help".

Step 2) **Go to Craigslist/ FB Marketplace**

> (or the alternative for your country such as Gumtree etc)
> 
> Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, Gumtree, the alternative platforms for your country or where you will find items and sell your items.

Step 3) **Find Items**

> You will use the course as your guide.
> 
> You must find items for free or cheap as shown inside of the training modules.
> 
> If you have no items, you won’t make money.
> 
> Money is made through exchanging something somebody values for something you value aka money.

Step 4) **List items**

> The only way people will know about your items is by you listing them.
> 
>  Stop expecting to magically make money doing nothing.
> 
> We live in a physical world. 
> 
> For every action, there is always a reaction.
> 
> You will make money guaranteed as many other students of mine have. 
> 
> When you follow my instructions and list your items.
> 
> Meaning, take 2 to 3 good pictures of the item that you’ve gotten for free or for cheap.
> 
> You can even find items in your own house that you don’t use anymore to list and sell. 
> 
> Obviously you need your parents permission.
> 
> However, I am waking your mind up to the possibilities that will make you rich.
> 
> Right now, there are items around you that you don’t even use, which you could sell and make money with.
> 
> I accept zero excuses from you.

Step 5) **Profit**

> The way flipping works is you charge more for something than what you paid.
> 
> Meaning, if you got an item for $5 and you see other people selling summer items for $20. 
> 
> You sell your item for $15.
> 
> Giving you a $10 profit.
> 
> When somebody comes to buy a used item, they are looking to get it for cheaper than what they would pay if it was brand new.
> 
> Your items are good quality but because they’re used you don’t charge the full price.
> 
> So make sure to see what other people are selling items for, sell yours for less, but charge more than what you paid to acquire that item.
> 
> You can also get a lot of items for free meaning you profit, regardless of how much you charge.

Step 6) **Repeat**

> You are now making money.
> 
> The universe operates on math. 
> 
> Flipping is a numbers game. 
> 
> The more you sell, the more money you make 
> 
> Once you make $5 then you repeat it.
> 
> Now you have $10. 
> 
> Obviously you can sell items for much more than this.
> 
>  I’m simply waking your mind up to your new reality.
> 
> I want to be updated daily on the actions that you were taking from the $100 steps inside the "Ask the Professor" or "VIP chat".

**You now have in your hands the tools needed to begin building an actual business.**

Remember a business operates on SYSTEMS and teams.

Your next step is to put into action everything you’ve learned. 

From there you will progress to the next 2 levels of this campus, both come with various perks/roles.

•




"The Flipping Steps for Finding Success Flipping"

Are you going to implement the Flipping Course?

a Yes, I'm ready to make my first $100
